videos.title: Why was Kirby Dach -29 last season? Part2 #hockey #nhl #habs #montrealcanadiens #montreal #hockeyiq
videos.description:
Kirby Dach finished with a -29 plus-minus rating last season, the worse on the habs by a lot. But why? I analyzed every goal scored while he was on the ice during the 2024-25 season to see what we can learn so we can apply these lessons to our own play. üèí From risky backhand turnovers to getting caught puck-watching and defensive zone coverage mistakes, here‚Äôs what we can learn.

videos.title: Two Strides Can Cost a Goal #hockey #nhl
videos.description:
In hockey, every stride counts. This video breaks down a common mistake that even professional players make: stopping to read the play. 

We'll analyze a specific in-game moment where a defensive player hesitates for just two strides. This small pause creates a big opportunity for the opposing team, leading directly to a 2-on-1 and a goal. 

Learn why it's so important to keep your feet moving until you're certain your team has possession of the puck. Improving this one area of your game can be the key to speeding up your play and becoming a more effective player. 

#deephockey #deeperhockey #hockeyanalysis #hockeyiq #nhl #hockey

videos.title: The Backchecking Mistake That Can Cost You the Game | Hockey Strategy Breakdown
videos.description:
Ever wondered how a perfectly good defensive setup can collapse in an instant? In this video, we analyze a critical goal that resulted from a common but misunderstood backchecking error. It may look like laziness, but the real reason is a mental trick your brain plays on you in the heat of the moment.

We'll look at a crucial 2-on-1 goal, focusing on players like Reinhart and Knies, to pinpoint the exact moment the play breaks down. It all comes down to a simple rule: when your team doesn't have clear puck possession, you MUST keep skating. Too many players stop to read the play, giving up critical ground and creating odd-man rushes.

Learn the fundamental "Skate, Read, React" sequence that separates good players from great ones. By skating first and reading second, you'll always be in a better position to defend. We'll even show you how multiple players on the ice made the exact same mistake.

Subscribe for more in-depth hockey analysis and tips to improve your own game!

Keywords: hockey strategy, backchecking, hockey tips, defensive hockey, hockey iq, hockey analysis, 2 on 1, NHL analysis, player development, game 7, how to play hockey

#HockeyTips #HockeyIQ #Game7 #HockeyAnalysis #nhl #marner #knies #mapleleafs #panthers #hockey

videos.title: The #1 Mistake Defensemen Make After a Missed Shot - Short #2
videos.description:
In hockey, a single moment can change the entire game. For a defenseman, one of the most critical and often misread situations is what happens immediately after your partner takes a shot from deep in the offensive zone and misses the net. That sound of the puck hitting the boards should be an instant alarm bell.

This short highlights one such play during the Stanley Cup finals which resulted in a goal in double overtime for the opponents, showing real in-game  footage to explain how you can avoid this mistake.

You can find the full analysis here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NxMNAeth3Jw

#Hockey #HockeyTips #Defenseman #HockeyIQ #NHL #oilers #panthers
